episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including the unrealistic portrayal of working-class characters in children's movies, the ancient Roman tradition of giving party bags, Ernest Hemingway's theft of a urinal, and the peculiarities of medical diagnosis codes.

facts.fact: Grumpy from the Seven Dwarfs is not nearly Grumpy enough.
The ancient Romans had party bags.
Ernest Hemingway once stole a urinal from a bar, saying that he pissed away so much of his money into it that he owned it.
The official medical diagnosis code for being struck by a chicken is different to the official medical diagnosis code for being pecked by a chicken.
